entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
Hi SANA11,

let me add three things:

1) GL Account 16003000 points to depreciation account 64003000:

2) In the FOREACH Loop the statement

DATA([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA")

makes sure that the sum of the investments in the periodes before is stored in the current period in the variable #CUMMUL_VALUE.

In the example above this is 9000 in period 2

3) In the next loop cycle (period 3), the depreciation is calculated:

9000 * 4% / 12 = 30

entry.title: Re: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in S...
entry.content:
Hello @MohamedKharbouch,

overhead costs in product cost planning are created via the so called costing sheet. To summarize, the costing sheet consists of 3 parts, a base which contains the cost elements which should be subject to a surcharge, the overhead rate itself, which is in most cases a certain percentage and lastly the credit, which defines which cost center is credited whenever you allocate the overhead costs.

Please also take a look at the following learning page with a comprehensive description: https://learning.sap.com/courses/product-cost-planning-in-sap-s-4hana/applying-overhead-costs-to-a-product

You need to make sure that a costing sheet is assigned in the valuation variant (relevant for your specific plant) of the used costing variant.

By choosing the overhead account in the costing sheet and by assigning this account in the cost component structure to a certain cost component, you can steer if the overheads should be part of the cost of goods manufactured (e.g. material overheads) or the costs of goods sold (e.g. sales and administration overhead charges).

I hope this answers your questions.

Best regards
Marvin

entry.title: Re: VAT code in inboud INVOIC02: Can we override OBCD wit...
entry.content:
Hi,

I know it has been a long time ago, but anyway I will The way I resolved this issue in the intercompany the solution we have come up with.

Basically, we have activate the USEREXIT EXIT_SAPLIEDI_102 which gets triggered by the function module IDOC_INPUT_INVOIC_FI that creates the intercompany invoice. The tax code is stored in the internal structure DOCUMENT_DATA where FNAM is equal to 'BSEG-MWSKZ' and content is the FVAL.

The tax code from the intercompany invoice (IV) can be copied from VBRP using the entry from DOCUMENT_DATA where FNAM = 'BKPF-XBLNR'. The field FVAL contains the invoice number (VBELN).

The internal table DOCUMENT_DATA structured as follow: The field COUNT defines the item line in FB01, however it should read like this:

Count 000001 - Header Data

Count 000002 - First line

Count 000003 - Second line and so one. 

When your copies the tax code from VBRP, it should take this into account. It means first line from VBRP is equal to COUNT = 2, second line is COUNT = 3, then so on. 

Find attached the code for further details.

Best regards

Marcelo Chamon

entry.title: Re: how to avoid the unnecessary js calls in the sap fior...
entry.content:
Hi,

All those js files can be avoided by adding dependencies to your manifest.json 

For every library.js file you see being loaded, you want to add and entry to the libs section of your manifest:

When this is done, a single library-preload.js will be loaded, avoiding all the individual files

One of the largest (and therefore slowest) libraries we have observed is sap.ui.table

entry.title: Bank Statement SOAP API - Supplier Invoice Clearing Issue
entry.content:
# Bank Statement SOAP API - Supplier Invoice Clearing Issue

## Problem Description

**Objective:**
Post Bank Statement via ManageBankStatement API (SOAP) and clear corresponding Supplier Invoices.

**What we have implemented:**
1. Business Configuration for Memo Line has been configured
2. Bank Statement posted successfully via ManageBankStatement API (SOAP)

**Problem:**
1. Target Supplier Invoices are not being cleared automatically
2. The G/L Account posted by Supplier Invoice (SIV) differs from the G/L Account posted by Bank Statement
3. **Additional Issue:** Intermediate document shows Payment error: "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD" and Journal Entry is not created

**Request:**
Please identify which configuration is incorrect - whether the SOAP API structure is wrong or Business Configuration is incomplete.

---

## Steps to Reproduce

**Step 1:** Create Supplier Invoice (SIV-001, SIV-002) for Business Partner BP001
**Step 2:** Post Bank Statement via ManageBankStatement SOAP API (payload provided below)
**Step 3:** Check if Supplier Invoices are cleared automatically
**Step 4:** **Result:**
- Supplier Invoices remain open (not cleared)
- Payment document shows error: "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD"
- Journal Entry is not generated

---

## SOAP API Payload

```xml
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
<soap:Header/>
<soap:Body>
<glob:BankStatementBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
<BankStatement ActionCode="01">
<CompanyID>XX</CompanyID>
<HouseBankAccount>
<ID>1100000001</ID>
</HouseBankAccount>
<DocumentDescription>TEST Bank Statement</DocumentDescription>
<StatementDate>2025-09-18</StatementDate>
<ValidityYear>2025</ValidityYear>
<PostingDate>2025-09-18</PostingDate>
<OpeningBalanceAmount currencyCode="USD">1000000.00</OpeningBalanceAmount>
<ClosingBalanceAmount currencyCode="USD">997000.00</ClosingBalanceAmount>
<DebitTotalAmount currencyCode="USD">3000.00</DebitTotalAmount>
<CreditTotalAmount currencyCode="USD">0.00</CreditTotalAmount>
<ReleaseBankStatement>false</ReleaseBankStatement>
<ItemsTotalNumberValue>2</ItemsTotalNumberValue>

<!-- Item 1: SIV-001 -->
<Item ActionCode="01">
<ItemID>1</ItemID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<ItemDocumentDescription>Inv SIV-001</ItemDocumentDescription>
<BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>49</BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>
<PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>15</PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>
<PostedAmount currencyCode="USD">-1500.00</PostedAmount>
<BankValueDate>2025-09-18</BankValueDate>
<BankPostingDate>2025-09-18</BankPostingDate>

<PaymentExplanationItem ActionCode="01">
<ID>1</ID>
<BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>2025-09-18</BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>
<CompanyID>XX</CompanyID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<NetAmount currencyCode="USD">1500.00</NetAmount>
<GrossAmount currencyCode="USD">1500.00</GrossAmount>
<PaymentTransactionInitiatorInvoiceReference>
<ID>SIV-001</ID>
</PaymentTransactionInitiatorInvoiceReference>
<PaymentTransactionDestinatedInvoiceReference>
<ID>SIV-001</ID>
</PaymentTransactionDestinatedInvoiceReference>
</PaymentExplanationItem>
<PaymentExplanationNote ActionCode="01">
<OrdinalNumberValue>1</OrdinalNumberValue>
<Note languageCode="EN">Inv SIV-001</Note>
</PaymentExplanationNote>
<PaymentExplanationItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>true</PaymentExplanationItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>
</Item>

<!-- Item 2: SIV-002 -->
<Item ActionCode="01">
<ItemID>2</ItemID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<ItemDocumentDescription>Inv SIV-002</ItemDocumentDescription>
<BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>49</BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>
<PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>15</PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>
<PostedAmount currencyCode="USD">-1500.00</PostedAmount>
<BankValueDate>2025-09-18</BankValueDate>
<BankPostingDate>2025-09-18</BankPostingDate>

<PaymentExplanationItem ActionCode="01">
<ID>2</ID>
<BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>2025-09-18</BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>
<CompanyID>XX</CompanyID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<NetAmount currencyCode="USD">1500.00</NetAmount>
<GrossAmount currencyCode="USD">1500.00</GrossAmount>
<PaymentTransactionInitiatorInvoiceReference>
<ID>SIV-002</ID>
</PaymentTransactionInitiatorInvoiceReference>
<PaymentTransactionDestinatedInvoiceReference>
<ID>SIV-002</ID>
</PaymentTransactionDestinatedInvoiceReference>
</PaymentExplanationItem>
<PaymentExplanationNote ActionCode="01">
<OrdinalNumberValue>1</OrdinalNumberValue>
<Note languageCode="EN">Inv SIV-002</Note>
</PaymentExplanationNote>
<PaymentExplanationItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>true</PaymentExplanationItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>
</Item>

<ItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>true</ItemListCompleteTransmissionIndicator>
</BankStatement>
</glob:BankStatementBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>
```

---

## Analysis Questions

1. **G/L Account Determination**: Why do Supplier Invoice posting and Bank Statement posting use different G/L Accounts?

2. **Business Configuration**: Is there missing configuration for:
- BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode (49)
- PaymentTransactionCategoryCode (15)
- Memo Line automatic clearing

3. **Payment Error**: What causes "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD" error and prevents Journal Entry creation?

4. **API Structure**: Are the PaymentExplanationItem references structured correctly for automatic clearing?

---

## Environment
- SAP Business ByDesign
- ManageBankStatement SOAP API
- Automatic clearing configuration enabled

Any insights on the root cause and resolution would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
@hartmut_koernerThank you for your quick response. However, the issue is that when I execute the standard content, I'm not receiving any output, and I'm not sure why

 

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA" MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate] VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures] VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]

//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //Calculation and Data Writing //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FOREACH [d/Date] // Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12 ENDIF

// Accelerated Depreciation Method: Residual Book Value of previous period * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 2 THEN DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12 ENDIF

// Residual Book Value = Residual Book Value of previous period + Acquisition Value - Depreciation Value DATA([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA") - RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) // Cummulative Acquisition Value DATA([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA") ENDFOR

entry.title: Re: process code for routing idoc
entry.content:
Hello @Mahil 

The /SAPMP/ROUTING ALE message type is generated from the /SAPMP/BAPI_ROUTING_PROCESS BAPI

Therefore you should use the BAPI process code, in my opinion.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
@hartmut_koernergot it Thank you for your quick response. Another issue is that when I execute the standard content, I'm not receiving any output, and I'm not sure why.

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Set Configurations Definitions for the Advanced Formulas.
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_ALL_COMPANY_CODE], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
FOREACH [d/Date]
// Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF
// Accelerated Depreciation Method: Residual Book Value of previous period * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 2 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF
// Residual Book Value = Residual Book Value of previous period + Acquisition Value - Depreciation Value
DATA([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA") -
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount])
// Cummulative Acquisition Value
DATA([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA")
 
ENDFOR

entry.title: Re: UI Configuration and Boyum IPT
entry.content:
Hello Rashantha, It seems to me from the screenshots that you are using quite an old GUI version. The Enjoy theme was removed many years ago now. 

You should be using SAP GUI for Windows 8.00 by now on all machines. Since all other versions are out of support. 

See 147519 - Maintenance strategy / deadlines for SAP GUI for Windows / SAP GUI for Java

entry.title: Re: New SAP Build Process Automation content for side-by-side extensions with flexible workflows
entry.content:
@MustafaBensan  I clarified the proposal / guidance. So it is without extension step (you don´t need another workflow, only agent determination asfaiu) with onstack (BAdI) plus Side-by-Side extensibility (SBPA Decision on SAP BTP).

You could implement a custom rule with a BAdI in SAP S/4HANA responsibility management which is used by a flexible workflow definition. Inside the BAdI you can call a REST API. So at runtime creation of workitems agent could be determined by a decision on SBPA, you invoke via the API call in SAP S/4 HANA. There is a small technical restriction: the outbound REST call generates a COMMIT, which can lead to problems in certain scenarios normally rare cases, but must be observed, and is solvable. The Decision needs to modelled and deployed using the SBPA tooling and later invoked via API. Following is the link to the API documentation: https://api.sap.com/api/SPA_Decision/path/invokeRuleServiceVersion

entry.title: How the cost estimation will happen in Campaign orders
entry.content:
I am creating a campaign in PCA1 and adding normal orders with cleanout orders in it. 
Created 3 production version
1. Planning - one recipe and BOM which has all activities and materials needed for both production and cleanout.
2. Production - Has another recipe and BOM with only the activities and materials necessary for producing one batch.
3. Clean out order - Has activities and materials necessary for cleaning (water, solvents, electricity, labor). Will have separate recipe group
Here I need to understand how the standard cost estimate will happen.
Do we need costing done for all Production versions. In standard it allows Standard costing for only one production version.
If costing done only for planning version, will there be no actual cost in Production & Cleanout orders?
Do all the actual cost will be settled as variance.
If so all the cost from cleanout and production order will be settled as variance and loss?
What is the normal business process to handle this.

entry.title: Re: Universal OData ↔ MCP Bridge; Or: How I Accidentally Made 15,000 Enterprise Services Talk to AI
entry.content:
Hi Alice,

it's not only in filter calls, where "guid" is missing. It's always missing, whenever there is a UUID. See

missing: (you get an error)
ZEHS_HSM_CHM_RAPP_C_CHEMICAL(ChemicalUUID='06188b1f-4e75-1fe0-a0c7-ec4e1da95d29',ChemicalRevisionUUID='06188b1f-4e75-1fe0-a0c7-ec4e1da97d29')?%24expand=to_FirstAidGeneral%2Cto_FirstAidEyeContact%2Cto_FirstAidSkinContact%2Cto_FirstAidInhalation%2Cto_FirstAidIngestion%2Cto_FirstAidPhysicianHint%2Cto_HSatz%2Cto_PSatz%2Cto_Ger%2Cto_PPEQeyeProtection%2Cto_PPEQhandProtection%2Cto_PPEQhygieneMasure%2Cto_PPEQrespProtection%2Cto_PPEQskinProtection%2Cto_SAPMaterial%2Cto_Document%2CXX_ZPICTOGRAMSET

correct: (this one works)
ZEHS_HSM_CHM_RAPP_C_CHEMICAL(ChemicalUUID=guid'06188b1f-4e75-1fe0-a0c7-ec4e1da95d29',ChemicalRevisionUUID=guid'06188b1f-4e75-1fe0-a0c7-ec4e1da97d29')?%24expand=to_FirstAidGeneral%2Cto_FirstAidEyeContact%2Cto_FirstAidSkinContact%2Cto_FirstAidInhalation%2Cto_FirstAidIngestion%2Cto_FirstAidPhysicianHint%2Cto_HSatz%2Cto_PSatz%2Cto_Ger%2Cto_PPEQeyeProtection%2Cto_PPEQhandProtection%2Cto_PPEQhygieneMasure%2Cto_PPEQrespProtection%2Cto_PPEQskinProtection%2Cto_SAPMaterial%2Cto_Document%2CXX_ZPICTOGRAMSET

Hope, it helps 🙂 

Redgards

Jarl

entry.title: Re: how to avoid the unnecessary js calls in the sap fior...
entry.content:
Bleow is the manifest code

 

{
    "_version": "1.28.0",
    "sap.app": {
        "id": "cour21selfser",
        "type": "application",
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "applicationVersion": {
            "version": "0.0.1"
        },
        "title": "{{appTitle}}",
        "description": "{{appDescription}}",
        "resources": "resources.json",
        "sourceTemplate": {
            "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",
            "version": "1.16.4",
            "toolsId": "3f6eb833-a369-4c9f-810d-d05d82a0153d"
        },
        "dataSources": {
            "ZFIN_E021_PO_SLF_SRV_HO_ANNO_MDL": {
                "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Annotations(TechnicalName='ZFF_SRV_HO_ANNO_MDL',Version='0001')/$value/",
                "type": "ODataAnnotation",
                "settings": {
                    "localUri": "localService/mainService/ZFNNO_MDL.xml"
                }
            },
            "mainService": {
                "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZF_SRV_HOME_SRV/",
                "type": "OData",
                "settings": {

entry.title: How to export business role template component in mass
entry.content:
Hi,

 

I need to export the component of the business role template in csv or excel file.

By e.g. for the “SAP_BR_CASH_MANAGER” business role template, I need to retrieve “FIN-FSCM-CLM”.

Can you tell me how may I extract this information in mass?

 

Kind regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to export business role template component in mass
entry.content:
Dear customer,

 

Thanks for reaching out.

It is not possible to mass extract component of business role template via the business role template application in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. But as a workaround, you can use the Fiori Apps Library, select the Product Suite as S/4HANA Public Cloud, select Leading Business PFCG Role column and Application Component column in Column Display Settings to display the business role template and component, then click Download button to mass export in excel.

Hope this helps clarify the issue.

 

Best regards,

Jannie

entry.title: Re: how to avoid the unnecessary js calls in the sap fior...
entry.content: So, at the moment, you are pre-loading sap.m and sap.ui.core. To find out what else you need to pre-load, go back to your network tab and click on the "library.js" entries. The URL will show the library to add to the libs section

entry.title: Provision of Sales Cloud V2 APIs via Integration Suite and Cloud Connector for on-prem clients
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

As part of our ongoing platform transformation, we are migrating to Sales Cloud V2 and S/4HANA. Initial testing within our sandbox environment has confirmed successful access to the Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

For productive use, we aim to establish a secure and scalable integration architecture by leveraging SAP Integration Suite in conjunction with the Cloud Connector. This setup is intended to enable on-premise clients to proactively consume Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

The envisioned scenario involves external calls initiated from on-prem systems, with responses returned from the cloud — for example, accessing data related to the Business Partner object.

We would like to validate whether this architecture is technically feasible and aligns with best practices for hybrid connectivity and secure API exposure.

recently we have a windows print server setup that involves two nic and their own IP addresses.

Ip number one can route, ip number two is in vlan that can't.

Windows printing it's ok but when sapsprint service start, it binding on wrong ip (vlan that can't route) and SAP refuse to print.

My question: is there a way to force sapsprint to bind to an ip instead other?
I find nothing on notes or googling....

Thanks a lot,

Gianluca

The screenshot I shared was just an example, the entries required depend on the what your app is using.

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an in...
entry.content:
The demo program you mentioned gave me a clue as to how to make my code more efficient. Here I've created a function that does exactly what I need and that performs well thanks to the GET_HIGHEST_ROW and GET_HIGHEST_COLUMN methods. 

The returned table has the following fields:
WORKSHEET 
ROW
COL
VALUE

FUNCTION zload_table_from_excel .
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_FILENAME) TYPE  CHAR1024
*"     REFERENCE(IV_BEGIN_COL) TYPE  I DEFAULT 1
*"     REFERENCE(IV_BEGIN_ROW) TYPE  I DEFAULT 1
*"     REFERENCE(IV_END_COL) TYPE  I DEFAULT 30
*"     REFERENCE(IV_END_ROW) TYPE  I DEFAULT 5000
*"     REFERENCE(IT_EXCLUDED_TABS) TYPE  OIJ02_DS_SEL_INTRANGE_T
*"       OPTIONAL
*"  EXPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(ET_INTERN) TYPE  ZALSMEX_TABLINE_T
*"  EXCEPTIONS
*"      ERROR
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
  
  DATA:
    lv_max_col     TYPE zexcel_cell_column,
    lv_max_row     TYPE int4,
    lv_value       TYPE string,
    ls_intern      TYPE zalsmex_tabline,
    lv_current_ws  TYPE sy-tabix,
    lv_current_row TYPE sy-tabix,
    lv_current_col TYPE sy-tabix.

  DATA(lo_reader) = CAST zif_excel_reader( NEW zcl_excel_reader_2007( ) ).
  DATA(lo_excel) = lo_reader->load_file( iv_filename ).

  TRY.

      DO.

        ADD 1 TO lv_current_ws.

        DATA(lo_worksheet) = lo_excel->get_worksheet_by_index( lv_current_ws ).
        IF lo_worksheet IS NOT BOUND.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.

        IF lv_current_ws IN it_excluded_tabs AND it_excluded_tabs IS NOT INITIAL.
          CONTINUE.
        ENDIF.

        lv_max_col =  lo_worksheet->get_highest_column( ).
        IF iv_end_col IS SUPPLIED AND iv_end_col < lv_max_col.
          lv_max_col = iv_end_col.
        ENDIF.
        lv_max_row =  lo_worksheet->get_highest_row( ).
        IF iv_end_row IS SUPPLIED AND iv_end_row < lv_max_row.
          lv_max_row = iv_end_row.
        ENDIF.

        lv_current_row = iv_begin_row.
        DO.

          ADD 1 TO lv_current_row.
          IF lv_current_row GT lv_max_row.
            EXIT.
          ENDIF.

          lv_current_col = iv_begin_col.
          DO.

            ADD 1 TO lv_current_col.
            IF lv_current_col GT lv_max_col.
              EXIT.
            ENDIF.

            CLEAR: ls_intern-zvalue.

            lo_worksheet->get_cell( EXPORTING
                                       ip_column = lv_current_col
                                       ip_row    = lv_current_row
                                     IMPORTING
                                       ep_value  = lv_value
                                   ).

            IF lv_value IS NOT INITIAL.
              ls_intern-zworksheet = lv_current_ws.
              ls_intern-zrow       = lv_current_row.
              ls_intern-zcol       = lv_current_col.
              ls_intern-zvalue     = lv_value.
              APPEND ls_intern TO et_intern.
            ENDIF.

          ENDDO.

        ENDDO.

      ENDDO.
    CATCH zcx_excel .
      RAISE error.
  ENDTRY.
ENDFUNCTION.

entry.title: Integrating Joule into Eclipse IDE without re-installing – A Quick Guide
entry.content:
With SAP’s recent focus on developer productivity, Joule is becoming an integral part of our toolset. If you’re already working with Eclipse IDE and ABAP Development Tools (ADT), you might be wondering how to bring Joule into your existing setup without starting from scratch.

In this blog, I’ll walk you through a simple process to enable Joule in Eclipse if you already have an older version installed.

Why Joule in Eclipse?

Joule brings AI assistance right into your familiar development environment. Gone are the days when boring coding used to happen. Now we have Joule to explain the code, finding out the dependencies like which ABAP objects( DB tables, CDS views, interfaces, etc) are referred in long code lines which never ends, Joule can understand your code and write ABAP units for you in no time.

Less talking, more work. Let's follow the steps below and get yourself introduce to one and only "Joule". 

Step 1 – Update ADT Patch

Ensure that your Eclipse has the latest ABAP Development Tools (ADT) patch.

  1. Open Eclipse.

  2. Go to Help → Install New Software.
     

  3. Add the latest ADT update site:

    https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/latest
     

  4. Select the updates and proceed with installation.

Step 2 – Update Eclipse Version

To access the Joule menu, Eclipse itself needs to be updated.

  1. Go to Eclipse menu → About Eclipse IDE.

  2. Click the Update button.

  3. Wait for Eclipse to fetch and apply updates.

That’s It!

Once the update is complete, you’ll notice the Joule option appearing in your Eclipse menu.

entry.title: BP Legal Form changes not updating KNA1-GFORM
entry.content:
We are facing an issue in our MDG on S/4HANA landscape related to BP → Customer (CVI) synchronization.

  • When a Business Partner is created with a Legal Form (Legal Status), the value is correctly updated into KNA1-GFORM during the initial creation.

  • However, when we later update the Legal Form in BP (through MDG Change Request), the change is not reflected in KNA1-GFORM after activation.

  • CVI customizing and mapping (Legal Status ↔ Legal Form) is already in place and checked.

  • Other field updates (e.g., name, address) are working fine and replicating properly.

  • There are no errors in activation or replication logs  the update just doesn’t reach KNA1.

Any guidance, experience, or reference to OSS notes would be very helpful.

entry.title: Duplicate supplier check - Configure matching using the configure matching app
entry.content: Hi all - my client wants a duplicate supplier check and wants to use SAP standard matching configuration.  This app is where the fuzzy matching configuration lives.  When we create a supplier where ALL the details match 100% it does flag as a duplicate.  However if we create a supplier where some details are different for example street house number are different but name and post code are an exact match the supplier does not flag as a potential duplicate.  I have read the documentation around this but can't find anything that says how this check is working.  I'm assuming the control is via this config but I don't understand how the weighting and fuzzy checks are working.  Does anyone have experience of using this config who can give me any advise details of how this config is working or how to configure so duplicate are caught in all cases eg: duplicate post code etc......  ~The SAP help doesn't actually explain this functionality very well.  Also - any comments on limitations with this config??

entry.title: Re: SAC - Linking multiple models
entry.content:
Yes, you're correct! In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), you can link multiple BW queries as models using the Link Dimensions feature and then combine the data from these models into a single story. However, after linking the models, you need to handle how the measures and dimensions from the different models are merged and displayed.

Here’s a step-by-step approach and suggestions for how to implement the story from multiple BW queries in SAC.

1. Create Models from BW Queries

To start, you need to connect the BW queries to SAC. Once connected, you can use the Link Dimensions feature to link different models that correspond to the different BW queries you want to integrate into a single story.

Steps to Create Models:

  1. Connect SAC to your BW system:

    • Go to the Connections section in SAC and establish a connection to your SAP BW system.

    • Use SAP BW Live Data Connection to link the BW system to SAC.

  2. Create Models from BW Queries:

    • Open the Models section in SAC.

    • Click + to create a new model.

    • Select the BW Query as the data source.

    • Choose your BW Query from the list.

    • Define the dimensions and measures that you need in the model.

  3. Repeat this for all 4 BW Queries:

    • You need to repeat this process to create separate models for each BW Query (assuming each query represents a different dataset you want to use in the story).

2. Link Dimensions in SAC

The Link Dimensions feature in SAC allows you to link dimensions from different models to create a unified view of the data. This is essential when you are working with data from multiple models (i.e., 4 BW queries in your case).

Steps to Link Dimensions:

  1. Create a New Story:

    • After creating the models, go to the Stories section in SAC and create a new story.

  2. Add a New Widget/Chart:

    • Drag and drop a widget (like a table, bar chart, etc.) onto the story canvas.

  3. Select the First Model:

    • Choose the first model (one of the 4 BW queries) and select the dimensions and measures you want to display in the widget.

  4. Link Dimensions:

    • Now, click on the Link Dimensions button.

    • Link the common dimension between the models. For example, if you have a common dimension like Customer, Time, or Product, you will link those dimensions across the different models.

    For example, if you have Model A, Model B, Model C, and Model D, and they all have a common dimension Customer:

    • In the dimension tab of Model A, select the Customer dimension.

    • In Model B, select the Customer dimension as well.

    • SAC will automatically link the Customer dimension between these models based on the shared values.

  5. Link Measures:

    • After linking the dimensions, you can select the measures from each model. These can be individual measures, like Sales, Quantity, or Cost, depending on your data.

    SAC will match the data on the linked dimensions and combine the measures from the different models.

    If you want to include multiple measures from different models (e.g., Sales from Model A and Cost from Model B), SAC will combine them based on the common linked dimension.

3. Handling Different Measures and Dimensions

Now, after linking the dimensions, you need to ensure that you properly handle the measures and dimensions in your storyboard (the SAC canvas):

  • Measures:

    • When linking models, SAC allows you to choose measures from different models.

    • Each model will bring its own set of measures (e.g., Sales, Quantity, Cost), but you will be able to drag and drop them into the same chart or table based on the linked dimensions.

    • If there are overlapping measures with the same name, SAC will append them with model identifiers (like Measure from Model A, Measure from Model B) to avoid any conflicts.

  • Dimensions:

    • The common dimensions (like Customer, Product, Region, Time) will be available across all models once linked.

    • Ensure that the dimension types (e.g., time, location, customer) are consistent across the models to avoid confusion when combining them.

Example Scenario:

Imagine you have 4 BW queries:

  • Model A: Sales data (Measures: Sales Amount, Quantity)

  • Model B: Cost data (Measures: Cost, Profit)

  • Model C: Customer data (Dimensions: Customer, Region)

  • Model D: Time data (Dimensions: Year, Month)

Here’s how you can handle this:

  • Link common dimensions: Link Customer from Model C and Region from Model C to the corresponding dimensions in the other models.

  • Add measures from different models:

    • You can have Sales Amount and Quantity from Model A, Cost and Profit from Model B, while also adding the Customer and Region dimensions from Model C, and Year and Month from Model D.

This will give you a combined table or chart showing sales, cost, and profit by customer and region, over time.

4. Considerations When Linking Multiple Models

  • Data Compatibility: Make sure the dimensions you're linking are of the same type and have consistent formatting across all the models. For example, if one model has Year in a number format and another has it in a string format, SAC may not be able to link them correctly.

  • Performance: Be mindful of performance when linking a large number of models. It can impact the query execution time and the user experience, especially with large data sets.

  • Aggregation: When linking measures across models, SAC will automatically aggregate the data based on the linked dimensions. Ensure that the granularity of the measures aligns across the models, especially when it comes to time-based data (e.g., monthly vs. yearly).

5. Finalizing and Displaying in Story

Once you’ve linked the dimensions and selected the appropriate measures, you can finalize the story:

  • Add visualizations like charts, tables, or KPI widgets.

  • Use filters to allow users to slice and dice the data based on different dimensions.

  • Customize the layout to present a unified, comprehensive view of the data from all 4 BW queries.

Summary

  • Step 1: Create models for each of the 4 BW queries in SAC.

  • Step 2: Use the Link Dimensions feature to connect the models by their common dimensions.

  • Step 3: Add the relevant measures from each model to your widgets.

  • Step 4: Ensure that the linked dimensions are compatible and correctly display the measures from all models.

By following these steps, you’ll be able to combine the data from the 4 BW queries and create a unified story with SAC.

Let me know if you need any further clarification!

entry.title: Re: How to trace the service confirmation document and it...
entry.content:
Hello @LDB 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these links Create Preliminary Billing Documents,  Event-Based Revenue Recognition & Journal Entry API Reference for more details. Below is a summary.

Yes, the preliminary billing document does not create accounting postings in public cloud. For that reason, provisional revenue recognition cannot be tied to the proforma itself.

In regard to your first question on service confirmation document. The answer is no and the reason is, revenue recognition in public cloud standard is tied to good issue or actual billing but not service confirmation.

On the second question regarding where you can view or trace the confirmation document. You can see the service confirmation document in the document flow app as shown in your screenshots, in your manage customer line item only if accounting postings exist and in the display document flow or sales order fulfillment monitor. The summary is, it is only traceable as a logistics reference and not in accounting.

Considering proforma billing is only meant for information you can choose between using a custom extension in BTP or Event-based revenue recognition to achieve provisional recognition with Proforma.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Contract Type field not in Job Info. table
entry.content:
Hi

Hopefully I really simple question to answer please. I'm working with a Story report in our production environment.

In the Job Information table, Contract Type is not listed. Even though its in the employee information in the Job Information section its just not listed in the table. I'm really baffled as to why this field is not visible in the table. I'm just wondering if anyone else has seen this issue and has a workaround please? I assume its not a permissions issues as that would be weird for this particular Field.

I know there are separate country tables which has Contract Type but there are about 80 of them. I am going to go through them all. I  just wondered if anyone else has experienced this as it seems very strange that 1 field in the job info section in someone's profile, is not available in the standard Job Info table. Why, if I find it, would this particular field be in a random country table on its own? Makes no sense to me.

Thanks in advanced.

entry.title: Re: SAC date filter in story: how to get most current dat...
entry.content:
✅ Solution Options

✅ Option 1: Use an Input Parameter with Default = Max(Date)

This is the best-practice method if you control the Calculation View design.

🔧 Steps (HANA Calculation View):

  1. Create an Input Parameter:

    • Add an input parameter P_DATE of type Date.

    • Mark it as mandatory.

    • Set default value to MAX("Date") using a derived value or calculated default.

    Example expression (in default value definition):

    SELECT MAX("FACT_DATE") FROM "YOUR_TABLE"

    Or use a calculated column in the view that fetches the latest available date and assign it as the default value.

  2. Use P_DATE in a filter condition:

    • E.g., [FACT_DATE] = $P_DATE

  3. Expose P_DATE to SAC:

    • When SAC story loads, it will pre-fill the filter with the latest available date from the data.

  4. Allow override in SAC:

    • When users open the story, they can manually change the Input Parameter via the prompt panel or story input control.

🟢 Pros:

  • Dynamic by design: Always uses the latest available date in the data.

  • User-friendly: Users can override it.

  • No SAC scripting needed.

🔴 Cons:

  • Requires you to modify the Calculation View.

  • Only works if you use the Input Parameter in filtering logic inside the view.

✅ Option 2: Add "Is Latest Date" Flag in the View

If you can't or don't want to use Input Parameters, you can:

  1. In your Calculation View, add a calculated column:

    CASE WHEN "FACT_DATE" = (SELECT MAX("FACT_DATE") FROM "YOUR_TABLE") THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END AS IS_LATEST_DATE

  2. In SAC:

    • Add a filter on IS_LATEST_DATE = 'Y' as the default.

    • Let users remove this filter and use a standard date filter instead.

🟢 Pros:

  • Works with SAC filters (no parameters needed).

  • Gives full control to the story designer.

🔴 Cons:

  • Still requires Calculation View change.

  • May have performance impact if MAX() isn't optimized.

✅ Option 3: Use a "Latest Date" Table or Variable in the View

An enterprise-friendly method:

  1. Create a small HANA table/view: LATEST_FACT_DATE

    • Contains only 1 row: LATEST_DATE = '2025-07-31'

    • Update this table via ETL or script each time new data is loaded.

  2. In your Calculation View:

    • Join this table to your fact table.

    • Filter the fact table: FACT_DATE = LATEST_DATE

  3. In SAC:

    • This becomes the default behavior.

    • Users can remove the filter and see other dates.

🎯 SAC Implementation (Story-Side)

Once your Calculation View handles the default latest date logic:

  • In SAC:

    1. Create an Input Control for the Date (bound to the Input Parameter or Dimension).

    2. Set the default selection to:

      • Prompt default (if using Input Parameter), or

      • Filter IS_LATEST_DATE = Y (if using flag method).

    3. Allow users to change the selection freely.

🛑 What Not to Do

  • Don’t try to rely on SAC’s system date – it's not tied to the data and won't work if data is delayed (as in your case).

  • Don’t try to implement logic in the story alone — SAC doesn’t support "dynamic default filters" based on max data values out of the box (especially with live models).

✅ Summary

Option Description SAC Compatible User Override Recommended For

Input Parameter with MAX(Date)Default input param = latest date✅✅Cleanest solution
"Is Latest" Flag in ViewAdd a calculated column for latest flag✅✅If you can’t use params
Latest Date Join TableMaintain latest date in a separate table and join✅✅If you're using ETL
SAC Story Filter OnlyStatic filters in SAC story✅✅❌ Not dynamic

Just that only delta synchronization does not work for them.

2. Back office charge the work order description in backend.

3. User A makes sync(delta) and see the updated data.

4. User B makes sync (delta) but does not see the updated data. —- this is the issue.

entry.title: SAP Enable Now: Issues with Automatic Content Visibility in Translation Workarea
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We’re currently facing a challenge with our SAP Enable Now setup and would appreciate any guidance or suggestions.

We’ve created two separate Workareas:

  • Workarea 1 – for content creation
  • Workarea 2 – for translating the published content from Workarea 1

Our goal was to have all published content from Workarea 1 automatically visible in Workarea 2, so that our translation team could work directly from there. To achieve this, we configured Workarea 2 to use Workarea 1 as its Base Workarea, following the instructions provided under:

Manager > Administration > Server Settings > Connected Workarea > Enable Workarea Extensibility Feature

We understood that this setup should allow content from Workarea 1 to be visible and editable in Workarea 2. However, we’re encountering the following issues:

  • When opening Workarea 2 in Producer, the tree structure is incorrect or incomplete.
  • Changes made in Workarea 1 are not properly reflected in Workarea 2.
  • We attempted to manually import content using the archive import function, but even then, the structure remains incomplete and inconsistent.

Within this project, the setup is shown correctly for one of our consultants, however, on my side, it does not show up correctly. This will become an issue once we need to scale this setup to tens of authors.

Therefore, this setup is currently not usable for our translation workflow, and we urgently need a solution.

Has anyone experienced similar issues or found a reliable way to make the Base Workarea functionality work as expected for translation purposes?

Any help or advice would be greatly appreciated!

Best regards,
Janice

entry.title: Receivables Clearing run BYD
entry.content:
Hi gurus

We are using the DueClearingUtilities library (SAP Business ByDesign) and the job works with receivables open items, posting massively clearing documents for every open item included following the selection criteria: by customer, by open item amount... but we can't find a way to clear open items between each other. I mean, a customer invoice 1000 USD and a credit memo  -1000 USD. The system always clears the items individually versus a differences GL account.

Is this really possible to perform it? or at least to be able to filter in the selection criteria all the customers with total receivables balance of 0 or 0,01 could be useful, as the total resulting amounts of example given in 2 clearing JE would be 0.

Thanks

Regards

entry.title: Re: Learning Notification not received in SF MS Teams chat
entry.content:
Hi,

This issue occurs when sync not happened between Learning and latest people profile, please raise a case with SAP and ask them to sync the data between learning and latest people profile after that the learning notifications will be available in MS teams.

entry.title: Re: BP Legal Form changes not updating KNA1-GFORM
entry.content: This is a known issue where the KNA1-GFORM field does not update through the standard CVI synchronization process during a change request, even though other fields do. This is because the field is not actively managed for subsequent updates. The recommended solution is to implement a Business Add-In (BAdI), such as CVI_CUSTOM_MAPPER, to manually update the KNA1-GFORM field directly with the new value during the CVI synchronization process.
